[30;1m92 | [0m[35m[0m

   Rule Id: [34mBD000701[0m

[30;1m78 | [0m[35m        self._username = username[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m374[0m[34m of [0m[33m1570[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000701[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Token[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mHigh[0m
  Filename: [33m/azure_identity-1.21.0/azure/identity/_credentials/user_password.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m(npm owner|password|htpasswd|auth_?token|secret_?key|private_?key|authorized_keys?|npmrc|\.ssh|usersecrets?|api_?keys|nuget\.config|\.identityservice)[0m
[30;1m74 | [0m[35m        # validate the given password. This class therefore doesn't document the authentication_reco[0m
[30;1m75 | [0m[35m        # discard it here.[0m
[30;1m76 | [0m[35m        kwargs.pop("authentication_record", None)[0m
[30;1m77 | [0m[35m        super(UsernamePasswordCredential, self).__init__(client_id=client_id, **kwargs)[0m
[30;1m78 | [0m[35m        self._username = username[0m
[30;1m79 | [0m[35m        self._password = password[0m
[30;1m80 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m375[0m[34m of [0m[33m1570[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000701[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Token[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mHigh[0m
  Filename: [33m/azure_identity-1.21.0/azure/identity/_credentials/user_password.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m(npm owner|password|htpasswd|auth_?token|secret_?key|private_?key|authorized_keys?|npmrc|\.ssh|usersecrets?|api_?keys|nuget\.config|\.identityservice)[0m
[30;1m71 | [0m[35m        )[0m
[30;1m72 | [0m[35m        # The base class will accept an AuthenticationRecord, allowing this credential to authentica[0m
[30;1m73 | [0m[35m        # first time it's asked for a token. However, we want to ensure this first authentication is[0m
[30;1m74 | [0m[35m        # validate the given password. This class therefore doesn't document the authentication_reco[0m
[30;1m75 | [0m[35m        # discard it here.[0m
[30;1m76 | [0m[35m        kwargs.pop("authentication_record", None)[0m
[30;1m77 | [0m[35m        super(UsernamePasswordCredential, self).__init__(client_id=client_id, **kwargs)[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m376[0m[34m of [0m[33m1570[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000701[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Token[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mHigh[0m
  Filename: [33m/azure_identity-1.21.0/azure/identity/_credentials/user_password.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m(npm owner|password|htpasswd|auth_?token|secret_?key|private_?key|authorized_keys?|npmrc|\.ssh|usersecrets?|api_?keys|nuget\.config|\.identityservice)[0m
[30;1m62 | [0m[35m            :caption: Create a UsernamePasswordCredential.[0m
[30;1m63 | [0m[35m    """[0m
[30;1m64 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m65 | [0m[35m    def __init__(self, client_id: str, username: str, password: str, **kwargs: Any) -> None:[0m
[30;1m66 | [0m[35m        warnings.warn([0m
[30;1m67 | [0m[35m            f"{self.__class__.__name__} is deprecated, as is it doesn't support multifactor "[0m
[30;1m68 | [0m[35m            "authentication (MFA). For more details, see https://aka.ms/azsdk/identity/mfa.",[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m377[0m[34m of [0m[33m1570[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000701[0m

[30;1m1255 | [0m[35m  - On Linux, the persistent cache requires libsecret and `pygobject`. If these[0m
[30;1m1256 | [0m[35m    are unavailable, or libsecret is unusable (e.g. in an SSH session), loading[0m
[30;1m1257 | [0m[35m    the persistent cache will raise an error. You may optionally configure the[0m
[30;1m1258 | [0m[35m    credential to fall back to an unencrypted cache by constructing it with[0m
[30;1m1259 | [0m[35m    keyword argument `allow_unencrypted_cache=True`.[0m

[30;1m857 | [0m[35mraising an error when none is passed. Although `get_token()` may sometimes[0m
[30;1m858 | [0m[35mhave succeeded in prior versions, it couldn't do so consistently because its[0m

[30;1m817 | [0m[35m  ([#11134](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-python/issues/11134))[0m
[30;1m818 | [0m[35m  - On Linux, the persistent cache requires libsecret and `pygobject`. If these[0m
[30;1m819 | [0m[35m    are unavailable, or libsecret is unusable (e.g. in an SSH session), loading[0m
[30;1m820 | [0m[35m    the persistent cache will raise an error. You may optionally configure the[0m
[30;1m821 | [0m[35m    credential to fall back to an unencrypted cache by constructing it with[0m
[30;1m822 | [0m[35m    keyword argument `allow_unencrypted_cache=True`.[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m780 | [0m[35m  access tokens they acquire in a persistent cache. To enable this, construct[0m
[30;1m781 | [0m[35m  the credential with `enable_persistent_cache=True`. On Linux, the persistent[0m
[30;1m782 | [0m[35m  cache requires libsecret and `pygobject`. If these are unavailable or[0m
[30;1m783 | [0m[35m  unusable (e.g. in an SSH session), loading the persistent cache will raise an[0m
[30;1m784 | [0m[35m  error. You may optionally configure the credential to fall back to an[0m
[30;1m785 | [0m[35m  unencrypted cache by constructing it with keyword argument[0m
[30;1m786 | [0m[35m  `allow_unencrypted_cache=True`.[0m

[30;1m96 | [0m[35m        This is an alternative to `get_token` to enable certain scenarios that require additional pr[0m
[30;1m97 | [0m[35m        on the token. This method is called automatically by Azure SDK clients.[0m
[30;1m98 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m99 | [0m[35m        The first time this method is called, the credential will redeem its authorization code. On [0m
[30;1m100 | [0m[35m        the credential will return a cached access token or redeem a refresh token, if it acquired a[0m

[30;1m52 | [0m[35m      * Run "azd auth login --client-id 'client_id' --client-secret 'client_secret' --tenant-id 'ten[0m
[30;1m53 | [0m[35m        to authenticate as a service principal.[0m
[30;1m54 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m55 | [0m[35m    You may need to repeat this process after a certain time period, depending on the refresh token [0m
[30;1m56 | [0m[35m    organization. Generally, the refresh token validity period is a few weeks to a few months.[0m
